section.title: Introduction

important.title: End of general support for &productname; &productnumber;
important.para: &productname; &productnumber; has reached the end of general support and is now in LTSS (Long Term Service Support).

If you have a &productname; subscription but do not have an LTSS subscription, you can continue to use your systems. However, registering new &rhla; &productnumber; or CentOS Linux &productnumber; systems with the general subscription is no longer supported.

Additionally, the optional &ha; extension is no longer supported with &productname; &productnumber; LTSS. You must remove this product from your system before you can register with an LTSS subscription.
If you previously registered your systems with a general subscription and want to move them to an LTSS subscription, see .

section.para: &productname; is a technology and support solution for mixed Linux environments. With a &productname; subscription, you can register and update &rhel; and CentOS Linux.
The following table shows which Linux distributions are supported by each subscription. These subscriptions also include an entitlement for a registration tool to manage package updates.

important.para: Registering &rhla; or CentOS Linux directly with &scc; is not currently supported.

section.para: This guide describes how to register with &suma;. &suma; is a lifecycle management system for mixed Linux environments. The &suma; Server is registered with &scc;, and other systems are registered as clients of &suma; and receive packages from it directly.
To register with &rmtool;, see Registering &rhla; &productnumber; or CentOS Linux &productnumber; with &rmt;.

section.title: Deploying &suma;
section.para:
See the following guide to install &suma; on &slem;, a lightweight, immutable operating system for containerized and virtual workloads:
&suma; Quick Start: Deploy &suma; Server.

You can use most &productname; subscriptions to register this machine. However, the Lite subscription only includes an entitlement for &rmt;, so if you want to use &suma; instead you will need a separate &suma; subscription.

important.title: &productname; &productnumber; LTSS repository size
important.para:
The &productname; &productnumber; LTSS repositories will grow over time because older package versions are not removed. Based on the current
As of 31 October, 2024 size of the repositories, to meet the 1.5 times size recommendation you will need approximately 15 GB of disk space for the default LTSS-Updates repository. If you need the optional LTSS-Source and LTSS-Debug repositories, you will need an additional 39 GB.

&productname; &productnumber; LTSS also has optional frozen BASE repositories that contain the packages from the non-LTSS repositories. If you need these repositories, to meet the 1.5 times size recommendation you will need approximately 210 GB for the BASE-Updates repository and 730 GB for the BASE-Source and BASE-Debug repositories.

important.para: The repository structure has changed in &productname; &productnumber; LTSS. If you previously registered your system with a general &productname; subscription, follow the Client Configuration Guide again to add and synchronize the LTSS repositories.
